pageContext.claim: “And so this is the second caravan, which is made up of some very tough young people -- very tough -- criminals in some cases, in many cases.”
pageContext.analysis: Any crowd of 7,000 people is going to have some bad apples. Mexican officials have already identified several and deported them, so they are no longer a potential threat. Trump's figure of 300 people is based on a fuzzy news release to justify presidential assertions, and officials refused to explain how the numbers were calculated. But reporters said the vast majority of the caravan was made up of women and children— not the "very tough young people" Trump is suggesting.
